title.rendered: Explain what is backbone.js ?

content.rendered:
Backbone.js is a JavaScript client-side (front end) framework, which helps to organize your code and makes it easier to develop single page applications.  It allows you to structure JavaScript code in an MVC  (Model, View , Controller) fashion

  • Model: It is a part of your code that populates  and retrieves the data
  • View: It is the HTML representation of this model
  • Controller:  It enables you to save your javascript application via a hashbang URl

excerpt.rendered: Backbone.js is a JavaScript client-side (front end) framework, which helps to organize your code and makes it easier to develop single page applications.  It allows you to structure JavaScript code in an MVC  (Model, View , Controller) fashion Model: It is a part of your code that populates  and retrieves the data View: It is the HTML […]

title.rendered: Explain what Ember.js is and how it works?

content.rendered:
Ember.js is used for creating web applications that eliminates boilerplate and at the same time provides a standard application architecture.

Ember helps to create applications, whose logic runs in browser and also it does not require server requests to functions. Ember update the DOM directly and instantly when any user interacts with things like button and text boxes on the browser page.

excerpt.rendered: Ember.js is used for creating web applications that eliminates boilerplate and at the same time provides a standard application architecture. Ember helps to create applications, whose logic runs in browser and also it does not require server requests to functions. Ember update the DOM directly and instantly when any user interacts with things like button […]

title.rendered: List out main components of Ember.js?

content.rendered:
The main components of Ember.js are

  • Models
  • The Router
  • Controllers
  • Views
  • Components
  • Templates
  • Helpers

excerpt.rendered: The main components of Ember.js are Models The Router Controllers Views Components Templates Helpers

title.rendered: Explain what is model in Ember.js?

content.rendered: Within an Ember application a model object is used to store persistent state. These model object back the templates and provide data to be displayed within the HTML.

excerpt.rendered: Within an Ember application a model object is used to store persistent state. These model object back the templates and provide data to be displayed within the HTML.

title.rendered: Explain how ember applications are structured?

content.rendered:
The application ember.js is based on MVC  (Model, View, Controller) structure

  • Models: It defines the data that is used in an application
  • Controllers: It modifies query and edit the data and provide user interactions
  • Views: It display the data and capture user actions

excerpt.rendered: The application ember.js is based on MVC  (Model, View, Controller) structure Models: It defines the data that is used in an application Controllers: It modifies query and edit the data and provide user interactions Views: It display the data and capture user actions

title.rendered: What controller does in Ember.js?

content.rendered:
Controller does two thing in Ember.js

  • First it can decorate the model returned by the route
  • It can listen to actions performed by users

excerpt.rendered: Controller does two thing in Ember.js First it can decorate the model returned by the route It can listen to actions performed by users

title.rendered: Explain how is ember.js is different than traditional web application?

content.rendered: In Ember.js, instead of majority of your application’s logic living on the server, an ember.js application downloads everything it required to run in the initial page load. So user does not have to load a new page while using the app and UI will responds quickly. The advantage of this architecture is that your web application uses the same REST API as your native App.

excerpt.rendered: In Ember.js, instead of majority of your application’s logic living on the server, an ember.js application downloads everything it required to run in the initial page load. So user does not have to load a new page while using the app and UI will responds quickly. The advantage of this architecture is that your web […]

title.rendered: Explain how Router and {{outlet}} tag can be useful in ember.js?

content.rendered:
• Router allows you to specify all the possible states of an app and map them to urls
  • To build a hierarchy of sections by providing a mean for a container template to include a child template the {{outlet}} tag is used

excerpt.rendered: Router allows you to specify all the possible states of an app and map them to urls To build a hierarchy of sections by providing a mean for a container template to include a child template the {{outlet}} tag is used

title.rendered: Explain what is the difference between Router and Route in ember.js ?

content.rendered:
Router:  It is the connecting point between browser’s address bar and our application.  It translates address into Route

Route: It is where a user request will land after it was translated by a Router.  Route decides what data should be provided to the Template

excerpt.rendered: Router:  It is the connecting point between browser’s address bar and our application.  It translates address into Route Route: It is where a user request will land after it was translated by a Router.  Route decides what data should be provided to the Template

title.rendered: Explain what is Ember-data ?

content.rendered: Ember-Data is a library that retrieve records from a server, store them, update them in the browser and save them back to the server.

excerpt.rendered: Ember-Data is a library that retrieve records from a server, store them, update them in the browser and save them back to the server.

title.rendered: Explain the role of adapter and types of adapters ?

content.rendered: Adapter queries the back end, each adapter is made up of particular back end. For example Rest adapter deals with JSON APIs and LSAdapter deals with local storage.

excerpt.rendered: Adapter queries the back end, each adapter is made up of particular back end. For example Rest adapter deals with JSON APIs and LSAdapter deals with local storage.

title.rendered: Explain what are the two ways of defining and inserting a view?

content.rendered:
First way

  • By extending the Em.View class, you have to create an oject in your JavaScript to define a view. You can declare your functions and variables inside that.
  • Now to insert a view in your template,  you have to follow the write the handlebar script {{ #view App.ViewName}}

Second Way

  • In this technique, the name of the view object is not required,while inserting into the template. But inside the object you have another property called as templateName which should be initialized with the value same as data template name attribute in handlebar’s script tag, in your template

excerpt.rendered: First way By extending the Em.View class, you have to create an oject in your JavaScript to define a view. You can declare your functions and variables inside that. Now to insert a view in your template,  you have to follow the write the handlebar script {{ #view App.ViewName}} Second Way In this technique, the […]

title.rendered: Explain what is controller in ember.js ?

content.rendered: When you have to handle a business logic you can use controller, a controller can represent a section of a page or entire part of it. It is like a block of logical functionality.

excerpt.rendered: When you have to handle a business logic you can use controller, a controller can represent a section of a page or entire part of it. It is like a block of logical functionality.

title.rendered: Mention the template components used in ember.js ?

content.rendered:
The template components used in ember.js are

  • Partial
  • View
  • Render
  • Yield
  • Outlet

excerpt.rendered: The template components used in ember.js are Partial View Render Yield Outlet

title.rendered: Explain what is serializer?

content.rendered: For turning a raw JSON ( JavaScript Object Notation ) payload returned from your server into a record object a serializer is responsible. JSON APIs may represent attributes and relationship in many different ways.

excerpt.rendered: For turning a raw JSON ( JavaScript Object Notation ) payload returned from your server into a record object a serializer is responsible. JSON APIs may represent attributes and relationship in many different ways.

title.rendered: How you can define a new ember class?

content.rendered: You can use call the extend () method on Ember.object to define a new ember class

excerpt.rendered: You can use call the extend () method on Ember.object to define a new ember class

title.rendered: Explain how you can create an Ember. handlebars  template?

content.rendered: Call Ember.Handlebars.Compile() to create an ember.handlebars template. It will return a function which can be used by ember.view for rendering.

excerpt.rendered: Call Ember.Handlebars.Compile() to create an ember.handlebars template. It will return a function which can be used by ember.view for rendering.

title.rendered: Explain how you can add data using fixture into an application?

content.rendered:
In order to put sample data into an application before connecting the application to long term persistence, fixtures are used.

  • First update js/application.js to indicate that your application’s application adapter is an extension of the DS.FixtureAdapter.  Adapters are used for communicating with a source of data for your application.  Usually, this will be a web service API.
  • Next, update the file at js/models/todo.js

excerpt.rendered: In order to put sample data into an application before connecting the application to long term persistence, fixtures are used. First update js/application.js to indicate that your application’s application adapter is an extension of the DS.FixtureAdapter.  Adapters are used for communicating with a source of data for your application.  Usually, this will be a web service API. […]

title.rendered: Mention some of the functions used in ember packages/ember run-time/lib and packages/ember metal/lib/utils.js ?

content.rendered:
• None : Returns tur if argument is null or undefined
  • Empty: Utility function constrains the rules on ember.none by returning false for empty string and empty arrays
  • isArray: Use this to check whether the value is an array
  • MakeArray: This function is used when you want a given object in an array
  • Typeof: This is used to get the type of the passed argument
  • Compare: Used to compare two objects of possibly different types
  • isEqual: It checks whether the passed two arguments are logically equal
  • inspect: While debugging this function is useful. For a given object it returns the string description
  • Log_Binding:  Log binding is not a function but a Boolean function. If set true ember will log all the activity that is happening on the bindings

excerpt.rendered: None : Returns tur if argument is null or undefined Empty: Utility function constrains the rules on ember.none by returning false for empty string and empty arrays isArray: Use this to check whether the value is an array MakeArray: This function is used when you want a given object in an array Typeof: This is […]

title.rendered: Explain what is Enumerables in ember.js ?

content.rendered: In Ember.js an enumerable is any object that contains a number of child objects, and enables you to work with those children using the Ember.Enumerable API. Native JavaScript array is the most common enumerable in majority of Apps.

excerpt.rendered: In Ember.js an enumerable is any object that contains a number of child objects, and enables you to work with those children using the Ember.Enumerable API. Native JavaScript array is the most common enumerable in majority of Apps.

title.rendered: Explain what is Ember.ArrayController and what is the advantage of it ?

content.rendered: Ember.ArrayController is a controller that wraps an underlying array and adds additional functionality for the view layer . The advantage is that you have to set up your view binding only once.

excerpt.rendered: Ember.ArrayController is a controller that wraps an underlying array and adds additional functionality for the view layer . The advantage is that you have to set up your view binding only once.
